attributes.action: We the people have no confidence in this government and demand it resigns.
attributes.additional_details: The PM, Chancellor, and Iain Duncan-Smith and others have lied to Parliament and the public (the electorate) numerous times over last parliament, this parliament and during the election campaign. Iain Duncan-Smith repeatedly lies in parliament and we believe his actions to be unministerial bringing both his office, parliament and the U.K. into disrepute. David Cameron stated quite clearly that there would be no cuts to tax credits. Their treatment of the vulnerable is unworthy of this country.
attributes.background: We the British Public have no confidence in this government, given it's repeated lies, breach of promise, and lack of compassion for the vulnerable. We demand a vote of confidence motion and resignation of ministers that lie to Parliament and the public. Lying should be against the ministerial code.

rejection.details:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/106407

We also have a petition asking for a vote of no confidence in the PrimeMinister:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/104471 

There are also petitions calling for a vote of no confidence in Iain Duncan Smith:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/104436
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/106803
